info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 27 at 7:12PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW PRODUCING LOW VISIBILITY AND A RETURN TO SLICK ROADS THIS EVENING... HAZARDS...Heavy snow showers accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH rapidly reduce visibility to near a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 710 PM EST, heavy snow showers were along and west of a line extending from near Davison to near Almont to near Marine City and moving northeast at 40 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Capac and Memphis around 715 PM EST. Columbiaville and Emmett around 720 PM EST. Lum around 730 PM EST. North Branch around 735 PM EST. Port Huron around 740 PM EST. Marlette and Brown City around 745 PM EST. Melvin around 750 PM EST. This includes the following highways... I-94 between mile markers 226 and 273. I-69 between mile markers 149 and 199. M-53 between mile markers 16 and 24. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this area of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents, especially when visibility is further reduced at night. &&
